name: FAITH: The Unholy Trinity (itch)
description:
FAITH: The Unholy is a pixel horror game by Airdorf. Use your holy crucifix to perform exorcisms, fight back against possessed cultists, and cleanse haunted objects. Discover a world of dread, isolation, and mystery as you explore haunted forests, abandoned churches, and the inner sanctums of a Satanic cult.

 

"I have to finish what I started."

What you are about to do has not been approved by the Vatican. As a young priest, struggle against demons, insane cultists, and your own weakening faith in this pixel horror game inspired by the era of classic 8-bit gaming and the "Satanic Scare" of the 1980s.

September 21, 1986
Two priests arrive at the Martin Family home in rural Connecticut to investigate an apparent case of demonic possession. Only two people would leave the house alive.

 

✞ EXPERIENCE ALL 3 CHAPTERS OF THE UNHOLY TRINITY ✞

✞ FAITH - Haunted by nightmares and searching for answers, a young priest returns to the house where an exorcism went horribly wrong a year before.

✞ FAITH: Chapter II - After confronting unspeakable paranormal entities and narrowly escaping with his life, a young priest descends into a new nightmare.

✞ FAITH: Chapter III - Aided by a mysterious stranger, a young priest travels the dark countryside to stop a Satanic cult from summoning a horrifically powerful demon.

Each chapter features
updates, multiple endings, forbidden lore,
hand-crafted animated cutscenes, custom music, and MORTIS ⛧ OCCULT SECRETS ⛧

Dive deeper than ever into the world of FAITH by discovering special unlockable content:

  • Game window border artwork by your favorite horror artists
  • Spooky screen effects
  • Additional gameplay modes
  • A super-secret NOT APPROVED BY THE VATICAN ending
 ♫ BLASPHEMOUS HYMNS ♫

Over 30 pieces of custom music, including 20 original tracks by Airdorf. Buy the FAITH - MORTIS EDITION to get the game + soundtrack!

🎁 GOODIES FROM BEYOND 🎁

Can you find the "Goodies" folder and discover the sinister secrets of FAITH's development?
